intro: Stoebe ramosissima, commonly known as clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It has a creeping rhizome and forms dense clusters of foliage. Its showy flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
